description: Strong bearish reversal candlestick pattern consisting of three consecutive long-bodied red candles with lower closes. Each candle opens within previous candle's body and closes near its low.
validationRules: Each candle has a relatively long body (minimal wicks)
Each candle opens within the previous candle's real body
Candles close near their lows with small lower wicks
Pattern typically forms after an uptrend or at resistance
invalidationSignals: Fourth candle forms as bullish engulfing or hammer
Large lower wicks indicating support/buying pressure
Any candle closes above previous candle's high
Pattern forms at major support level
commonMistakes: Entering on the third candle without waiting for confirmation
Ignoring support levels below the pattern
Not checking for volume increase across the three candles
Confusing with smaller bearish candles - bodies must be substantial
Trading pattern at end of downtrend instead of uptrend

tradeSetup.entry: Open of fourth candle or rally to resistance
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Above the high of the first black crow
tradeSetup.target: Nearest support or measured move based on pattern height

supportive: Volume increasing across the three candles
RSI moving from overbought toward neutral/bearish
MACD bearish crossover or negative divergence
Pattern forms at key resistance level
conflicting: RSI already oversold before pattern completes

confluenceFactors: Aligns with round number resistance level
